theories.rationale: These additions strengthen model alignment by explicitly modeling the legitimate peripheral participation process through which newcomers become integrated community members, and by capturing the boundary negotiation and shared repertoire development that define community identity and practice.

variables.name: Legitimate Peripheral Participation Rate
variables.description: The rate at which newcomers engage in simple, low-risk tasks at the community periphery, gaining initial competence and social acceptance
variables.rationale: Needed to model the initial engagement process where newcomers learn community norms through participation

variables.name: Community Boundary Permeability
variables.description: Effectiveness of community boundaries in filtering for compatible contributors while allowing legitimate access
variables.rationale: Captures the negotiation dynamics that determine who can participate and under what conditions

variables.name: Shared Practice Development Rate
variables.description: Rate at which community develops shared tools, stories, and ways of working through collective experience
variables.rationale: Models the development of shared repertoire that enables coordinated action and knowledge sharing

variables.name: Community Identity Strength
variables.description: Accumulated sense of shared identity and mutual commitment among community members
variables.rationale: Represents the social cohesion that sustains engagement and knowledge sharing over time

connections.rationale: Initial peripheral participation builds foundational skills needed for progression
More permeable boundaries enable more newcomers to engage in peripheral participation
Core developers may tighten boundaries to maintain community standards and identity
Developing shared practices strengthens community identity and cohesion
Stronger community identity reduces turnover by increasing member commitment
Stronger identity increases willingness to engage in mentorship and knowledge sharing

theories.rationale: These additions strengthen model alignment by operationalizing the four knowledge conversion modes (Socialization, Externalization, Combination, Internalization) specifically for open-source contexts, showing how tacit and explicit knowledge interact across different contributor levels and community activities.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Socialization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of shared experiences and observation in transferring tacit knowledge between contributors
variables.rationale: Models the socialization process where tacit knowledge is shared through joint activities

variables.name: Knowledge Externalization Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge is articulated into explicit forms like documentation and guides
variables.rationale: Captures the conversion of personal tacit knowledge to community explicit knowledge

variables.name: Explicit Knowledge Integration Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge from different sources is combined and systematized
variables.rationale: Models the combination process where explicit knowledge is organized and integrated

variables.name: Knowledge Internalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of learning-by-doing processes that convert explicit knowledge back to personal tacit knowledge
variables.rationale: Represents how contributors internalize documented knowledge through practical application

variables.name: Community Knowledge Base
variables.description: Accumulated explicit knowledge assets including documentation, code examples, and best practices
variables.rationale: Stores the community's collective explicit knowledge available for sharing and learning

connections.rationale: Effective socialization enhances mentorship by facilitating tacit knowledge sharing
More core developers increase opportunities for tacit knowledge sharing through collaboration
Core developers have more tacit knowledge to externalize into documentation
Externalization adds to the community's explicit knowledge assets
Larger knowledge base provides more material for explicit knowledge transfer
Integration processes organize and enhance the community knowledge base
Effective internalization accelerates skill development from documented knowledge
Better explicit knowledge transfer enables more effective internalization
Experienced contributors can better integrate and systematize knowledge from multiple sources

Knowledge Dynamics.integration_note: Integrates with existing knowledge transfer variables by operationalizing SECI model processes, connecting Core Developer and Experienced Contributors to knowledge creation and sharing activities

Contributor Progression.integration_note: Connects to existing progression variables (Skill up, Core Developer) by modeling boundary negotiation and legitimate participation processes that enable contributor advancement

Community Engagement.integration_note: Links to Developer's Turnover and knowledge transfer variables by showing how shared practices and identity influence retention and collaboration

clustering_strategy.rationale: Clusters organized around core community development processes, separating knowledge dynamics from contributor progression while maintaining logical flow between learning, participation, and advancement.

clusters.name: Knowledge Dynamics
clusters.theme: Processes of knowledge creation, sharing, and conversion within the community
clusters.rationale: Centralizes all knowledge-related processes from both theories, creating a cohesive understanding of how knowledge flows and transforms in the community
clusters.spatial_recommendation: Position centrally in region (500-800, 200-500) - available space and central connectivity to other clusters

clusters.name: Contributor Progression
clusters.theme: Movement of contributors through different participation levels and roles
clusters.rationale: Groups all variables related to contributor advancement through community roles, reflecting the journey from periphery to core participation
clusters.spatial_recommendation: Place in region (200-500, 500-800) - adjacent to Knowledge cluster with good capacity

clusters.name: Community Engagement
clusters.theme: Social participation and shared practice development within the community
clusters.rationale: Focuses on the social cohesion and engagement aspects that sustain community participation and reduce turnover
clusters.spatial_recommendation: Position in region (200-500, 200-500) - isolated region suitable for engagement-focused variables

layout_hints: Place Knowledge Dynamics cluster centrally as it connects to both Contributor Progression and Community Engagement clusters
Position Contributor Progression and Community Engagement clusters adjacent to each other since they share turnover and progression dynamics
Maintain Knowledge cluster between the other two clusters to minimize crossing connections
